author: Jason Douglas
title: Nerve Agent Used in Attack Was Developed in Soviet Union as a Weapon
text:
The class of nerve agent that British authorities believe was used to poison Sergei Skripal and his daughter in the English city of Salisbury is among the deadliest chemical weapons ever devised.
The Novichok group of nerve agents was developed in the Soviet Union in the 1970s and 1980s and was designed to be both lethal and virtually undetectable. Like other nerve agents, such as sarin and VX gas, Novichok compounds cause muscle spasms that can lead to respiratory failure and cardiac arrest.
